selected_quotes: Did you know? Public use of racist language is insufficient legal grounds for the expulsion of an MP from parliament ht…
It seems very unlikely that Anne Marie Morris’ position as an independent MP will be sustainable – legal expert
An act that would get the average person sacked for gross misconduct in the office, potentially arrested, for an MP,…
What does the law say about using racial slurs in the workplace?
Andrew Worthley, on MPs and racist language in The Conversation: @drewworthley

citation.abstract: The prime minister has suspended the whip from Anne Marie Morris, but she can't be dismissed as an MP for her remarks.
citation.title: MPs, racist language and the law: a legal expert explains

news.title: MPs, racist language and the law: a legal expert explains
news.summary: Theresa May, the UK prime minister, has suspended the Conservative party whip from backbench MP Anne Marie Morris for using a racist phrase – effectively expelling her from the party, at least temporarily.

news.title: MPs, racist language and the law: a legal expert explains
news.summary: Theresa May, the UK prime minister, has suspended the Conservative party whip from backbench MP Anne Marie Morris for using a racist phrase – effectively expelling her from the party, at least temporarily.

facebook.summary: (Un)surprisingly, public use of racist language is insufficient legal grounds for the expulsion of an MP from parliament.
